crew.p: Composers: Benj Pasek, Justin Paul, David Lynch

body.p: „Quiet Guide” is the beginning of a journey, where Ilze Zirina explores the relationship between intuition and intellect. Observations are exciting. It’s not so easy to get rid of the „I am a choreographer” swagger.

Every known truth knocks at consciousness at its own time. This tourist is 44. And her mentor in the process is: „…Subjectivity is just a way of structuring the experience. It's not a reality that spookily radiates from your eyes. In fact, your experience shows that „self” - the supposed subject – often arrives at  post factum. In many ways, the „self” is someone who runs at the end of a well-organized and already running parade and constantly shouts, „Look what I’ve done!”” – Rick Hanson, PhD, with Richard Mendius, MD.
